image.altText: A group of trees in a forest.

props.synopsis: The Liberals have released their housing policy ahead of next month's ACT election, with plans for a large development on the eastern edge of the territory.

title.children: Forest outside Canberra would be transformed into housing under Liberals election promise

image.altText: Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory

props.synopsis: Former ADFA cadet Jake Sullivan is on trial for six charges including rape, committing an act of indecency and assault.

title.children: 'I never forced her': Former ADFA cadet denies raping woman

image.altText: A black cat lies down on a towl with a cone around its neck.

props.synopsis: The RSPCA's ACT branch issues an appeal for information after multiple reported cases of animal cruelty in Canberra's north.

title.children: 'Incredibly cruel': Cats discovered with bound testicles in Canberra's north

image.altText: A portrait of a doctor wearing a stethoscope around her neck, seated next to a desk.

props.synopsis: Junior doctors in Canberra worried that unpaid overtime was putting themselves and their patients at risk. They have now reached a settlement with the ACT government.

title.children: Junior doctors given $31.5 million after suing over unpaid overtime

image.altText: Autumn leaves on trees and path next to Lake Tuggeranong.

props.synopsis: The ACT Greens have committed to a range of measures to combat climate change, including establishing a Chief Heat Officer, planting more trees, and bringing back Canberra's iconic bus shelters, if elected in October.

title.children: ACT Greens say they will create Chief Heat Officer if elected in October

image.altText: A woman with short grey hair stands at a lectern looking angry and hurt.

props.synopsis: When Harriet Spring publicly admitted she'd lost a $1.6 million inheritance to scammers, she had low expectations for both financial compensation and criminal consequences, but over the past week there's been progress on both fronts.

title.children: Woman who lost $1.6 million to scammers campaigns for change as seven people allegedly involved are arrested

image.altText: A portrait of a doctor in a consultation room.

props.synopsis: Health professionals and teachers want to do more to identify and help children and adults experiencing violence at home.

title.children: As many as one in two children are growing up in violent homes, research shows

image.altText: Josh Papalii pictured in action for the Raiders

props.synopsis: Raiders star Josh Papalii is being investigated by police after an alleged late-night incident at a Canberra leagues club following the team's end-of-season presentation.

title.children: 'Smashing glasses': Josh Papalii facing police investigation over Raiders' Mad Monday incident

image.altText: A collage that shows the faces of four men, next to the scales justice

props.synopsis: The NSW government supports all 19 recommendations from a landmark inquiry into historical gay hate crimes, saying victims and their families were "fundamentally failed" in the past and it can never occur again.

title.children: NSW government accepts all 19 recommendations from inquiry into LGBT hate crimes

image.altText: A view of a lage building with flags on top

props.synopsis: Australia's national unemployment rate remained steady in August at 4.2 per cent. The data comes after the US Federal Reserve cut rates by 50bp, sending US stocks lower, but the ASX200 lifted higher when the market opened.

title.children: Unemployment rate holds steady, US Federal Reserve cuts interest rates by 50bp, ASX200 lifts

image.altText: A composite of a man and a woman

props.synopsis: The US Federal Reserve cuts interest rates for the first time since the pandemic, and with the race for the White House in full swing both sides of politics move to push their narratives around what it means for the economy.

title.children: A US interest rate drop should be good for Harris and bad for Trump, but nothing is as it seems in 2024

image.altText: Jacqui Lambie at press conference

props.synopsis: The government has faced a grilling over the curious release of a secret military report, insisting it had no role in its publication.

title.children: Labor rejects claims it tried to cover up release of secret military report

image.altText: A man is arrested by officers

props.synopsis: A major criminal network alleged to have sold $1.8 billion of cocaine has been dismantled in a series of police raids.

title.children: Police dismantle Sydney crime network they allege sold $1.8b worth of cocaine in four months

image.altText: Men holding flags in front of the parliament 'Beehive' building.

props.synopsis: New Zealand has entered a period of right-wing politics, but the next generation of Māori activists are ready to respond.

title.children: NZ is debating a referendum that some fear 'would be the worst of all worlds'

image.altText: Soldiers in combat fatigues stand on a street at night

props.synopsis: At least 20 people have been killed in a series of fresh explosions targeting communications devices used by the Lebanese militant group Hezbollah.

title.children: 'Booby-trapped' communication devices kill dozens across Lebanon as UN calls for investigation

image.altText: An injured person is wheeled on a stretcher

props.synopsis: While Israel's alleged involvement in the pager and hand-held radio attacks in Lebanon may never be confirmed, the country's security and intelligence agencies have been linked to a string of assassination plots over the years.

title.children: Before pagers came toothpaste and tennis players to assassinate Israel's enemies

image.altText: Hannah sitting in the sun smiling with a drink in hand.

props.synopsis: The man accused of murdering 23-year-old Victorian woman Hannah McGuire has elected to fast-track the matter to the Supreme Court for trial.

title.children: Hannah McGuire accused pleads not guilty to murder, will stand trial in Supreme Court

image.altText: A large cloud of smoke and flames lights up a dark sky.

props.synopsis: Unverified video of the blast, which reportedly forced the evacuation of a nearby town, showed a huge ball of flame blowing up into the night sky.

title.children: Ukrainian drone strike causes major blast at Russian arsenal that was said to be 'reliable and safe storage'

image.altText: Peter Dutton speaking publicly outdoors, wearing a suit with a yellow ribbon pinned on the lapel.

props.synopsis: We have reached that point in the political cycle where the parliamentary clock is running down, opinion polls are being taken more seriously, and various efforts are underway to define the ground on which the election will be fought.

title.children: Labor's housing reform plans failed, now IR is in its sights

image.altText: Close-up of a restaurant waiter handing over food packets to a woman customer.

props.synopsis: PFAS chemicals are used in a vast number of waterproof, non-stick and stain-resistant products. But concerns about their environmental and potential health impacts have intensified in recent years.

title.children: Most of us have PFAS 'forever chemicals' in our blood. What does it mean for our health?

image.altText: Delegates sit in a semi-circle shape and look at a large stage and screens.

props.synopsis: The UN General Assembly overwhelmingly supports a resolution demanding Israel end its occupation of Gaza and the occupied West Bank within a year, but Australia abstains from the vote.

title.children: Australia abstains as UN General Assembly votes to demand Israel end Palestinian occupation

image.altText: A real estate listing of a 3-bedroom unit, with a picture of a large outdoor area at the top of the page.

props.synopsis: The three-bedroom property near Bronte Beach, listed for $950 a week, is only accessible through a kindergarten below, with tenants unable to leave or enter outside of its opening hours.

title.children: 'Red flags are flying high': Sydney rental listing locks out tenants for 10 hours a day

image.altText: A Bedouin rides a horse as a Harvest Supermoon is pictured in the background, in Rahat, southern Israel.

props.synopsis: From country to country, keen stargazers have diligently captured the September harvest supermoon.

title.children: Harvest supermoon lights up night skies and landmarks all over the world

image.altText: A woman sits at a desk with a keyboard, her pregnant belly is visible.

props.synopsis: Parents accessing the government-funded paid parental leave will receive an additional 12 per cent of their payments in super from July next year, after the federal government's legislation passed parliament.

title.children: Superannuation for parents on government-funded PPL passes parliament

image.altText: A pregnant woman receives her COVID-19 shot in Pennsylvania, January 2021.

props.synopsis: RSV is a highly infectious virus that is the most common cause of respiratory infections in children. A free vaccine could soon be available to help prevent it.

title.children: Everything you need to know about RSV and the new free vaccine likely to come next year

image.altText: An Australian senator in a red jacket.

props.synopsis: Senators found many medical students get just an hour of training in the subject despite half the country going through it at some stage.

title.children: 'Irrational, hysterical or crazy': Senate inquiry recommends reproductive leave for all as it calls for medical profession to step up

image.altText: Isaac Heeney, Zak Butters, Jeremy Cameron, Joe Daniher

props.synopsis: The race for the AFL premiership is down to just four teams. Here is what they need to nail this week in order to book a grand final spot.

title.children: Breaking down the AFL's final four and the secret weapons that could decide this year's grand finalists

image.altText: A court sketch of a man sitting next to a lawyer

props.synopsis: Tane Desatge will be eligible for parole in 2042 after being jailed for the murder of a two-year-old girl in Chinchilla in 2017.

title.children: Man jailed for at least 22 years over 'cruel, cold-hearted' murder of stepdaughter

image.altText: Illustration of space capsule with three figures sitting inside

props.synopsis: With NASA's crewed mission to the moon only a year away, first results from radiation experiments onboard Artemis 1 suggest short trips are within human limits, but longer missions or travel to Mars may be challenging.

title.children: We haven't visited the moon for half a century. These two dummies are making it safer for the next generation

image.altText: Whyalla Steelworks, generic

props.synopsis: The story of Whyalla has been told and retold, and is often framed as a tale of a town and its steel plant. That is not an inaccurate picture, but nor is it a complete one.

title.children: Australia's 'only' rail manufacturer is a 'strategic' asset, but is steeling itself for bad news

image.altText: A graphic of Betty Shanks photo with newspaper clippings following her death around it.

props.synopsis: The 22-year-old's battered body was found lying in a garden with a bloodstained tram ticket still clutched in her hand.

title.children: Betty Shanks was murdered walking home in Brisbane 72 years ago. Some believe her killer can still be found

image.altText: Men in protective medical gowns pile coffins into a mass grave.

props.synopsis: The high cost of burials is forcing Papua New Guinea families to abandon the bodies of loved ones at its public morgue, and many are ending up in mass graves.

title.children: Papua New Guineans 'think that they can avoid death'. When it happens, families are forced into mass burials

image.altText: Three students thumbs up leaning on minibus that says burketown state school

props.synopsis: While city slickers complain about long commutes to work, bush students travelling a 240km round trip to school each day are enjoying the ride.

title.children: The longest school bus run in Queensland doesn't bother these outback kids

image.altText: A young girl smiles widely as she hugs a scruffy, large dog. They are sitting on the tray of a ute with clear sky behind them.

props.synopsis: If you've never heard of the kangaroo dog, you're not alone. But it has an incredible story to tell about Australia's Indigenous and colonial history.

title.children: Roo dogs are the toughest Australian animal you've never heard of
